column11: Review Text

I booked this trip for my husband, a keen birder, and wasn‚Äôt expecting to derive much from it myself, however it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience for both of us. I had corresponded with Gayan, the owner, beforehand and his communication was timely and informative. On our arrival, we were met by our guide, Pasindu, who welcomed us and helped us onto the catamaran ably captained by Sanjeewa.  Once aboard, Pasindu gave us both a pair of binoculars and explained about the sanctuary and the lagoon. We set off and, thanks to Sanjeewa‚Äôs smooth navigation, spent a wonderfully relaxing two and a half hours travelling at a leisurely pace around the lagoon and through the mangroves. Pasindu pointed out not only numerous birds - including different types of kingfisher, storks, egrets, whistling ducks, ibis and Brahminy kites - but also macaques, water buffalo and flora. Our highlight was seeing a trio of hornbills. About halfway through our tour, we stopped to climb a rock to a viewpoint and sat for a while to admire the beauty and tranquility of the area whilst continuing our conversation with Pasindu about the local wildlife.  Once back on the catamaran, Pasindu gave us water, bananas and some savoury snacks that had been made by Gayan‚Äôs mother. We would thoroughly recommend this trip to both bird watchers and people who enjoy a peaceful boat ride in a beautiful setting.

Loved this mellow meander through water hyacinths and mangroves spotting birds and wildlife- we went at 4 - a lovely time of day and enjoyed being calmly punted along by  captain Sanjeev and leaning about the birds here from Pasindu- good balance between informing us and letting us soak up the tranquility. üôè

column8: A nature reserve that lives up to expectations and much more
column11: With birds and amphibians galore our knowledgeable guide, Pasindu, and the captain of the mini catamaran, Mahinda, taught us a lot a about the flora and fauna of the sanctuary. We saw pelicans, herrins, hawks and eagles, a huge monitor lizard and much more. There is no mass tourism and we found ourselves alone with nature. Highly recommend anyone to take a tour

column8: Great time with family close to birds
column11: A great time spent with family away from the noise and horn of the city. The guide was great, he took the time to explain all the species present in the lagoon. I recommend 100%

A wonderful way to spend a couple of hours, travelling slowly by catamaran across this beautiful, peaceful lagoon. We‚Äôre not bird watching experts, but our guide Pasidu was very knowledgeable, and good at spotting birds and other wildlife in the trees. I felt privileged to have had the chance to experience this fantastic nature reserve.

I had the most incredible experience at the sanctuary. Pasidu and Mahinda made the experience very special. I learned so much about the wildlife through their knowledge and wisdom. The scenery is breathtaking and it‚Äôs so peaceful there. I recommend doing the morning tour to see the sun rise as you set off!

Very calming moment on the lake, discovering the birds. Our young guide Pashidu was perfect sharing his knowledge about birds with us. Very welcoming, he prepared a small snack for us. At the end of the boat tour we climbed a small rock to see the sunset. Thank you very much for this moment.

The whole trip was a wonderful experience. The guide speaks English very well, has sharp eyes, a great knowledge of the present nature and a good sense of humor as well. We saw a lot of birds and the trip gave us a good ‚ÄúZen feeling‚Äù. What a huge difference with hectic places like Yala National Park. Thanks again! Janneke and Gerrit
If you are a bird  lover dont miss this sanctuary. This is one of the best birds  sanctuaries in asia. Also joning to the beach and lagoon. fantastic biodiversity

column8: Good boat trip, good guides, but limited biodiversity
column11: The lagoon is a lovely place for a morning boat tour (Gayan was great). It's charming and serene. However recent developments including the harbour has impacted on the biodiversity. Fewer bird species, but still a lot of common birds like egrets and ibis. If you really want a bird watching experience, there's better locations like Tissamahara nearby

We were lucky enough to go to this beautiful bird sanctuary early this morning and what an incredible experience.  Gayan organised a great guide and driver- no electric motors here just a paddle and a specially designed boat.  We spent 2 1/2 hours on this beautiful lagoon observing many species of birds whilst enjoying the calmness of the lagoon and soaking up bird talk from our very knowledgeable guide.  A must do excursion if you find yourself around Tangalle.  Or a hour and a half‚Äôs drive from Galle:@kalametiyaBirds.com.
We had the best and calm tour guide ever. We learnt a lot and we enjoyed the calm, relaxing and beautiful nature. We would love to come again!

This was a stunning trip in a beautiful tidal lake. Lots of bird life especially kingfishers, bee eaters and purple heron in the lovely peaceful early morning. All tours are private and you are transported around the lake on a punt so it is incredibly peaceful.  Our guide / owner Gayan was very knowledgeable about the wildlife and passionate about the ecosystem. Binoculars are provided as well as water and some snacks. A really lovely was to spend 2 - 2.5 hours. Thank you Gayan. Kalametiya birds.com

Great evening out on the lagoon with Buddhi and his boatman. We saw lots of birds and frogs and Buddhi came well prepared with bird books and binoculars. He was very knowledgeable about the birds and could spot them very easily.  Buddhi kept us well entertained with his flute playing and his magic tricks. Well worth the visit and Buddhi made an excellent guide.

We paid a second visit to this lovely water land park and were not disappointed. - it‚Äôs a wonderfully serene and relaxing way to spend a morning being carefully steered through the water plants and flowers, watching and hearing the resident birds. The 100% effective antidote to the mad world in which we live. Can‚Äôt rate this location highly enough
Still Virgin. very few people at this beach so you pretty much have the whole stretch of the beach to yourself. Perfect for long walks along the beach.

We were staying at Turtle Bay Resort and had an arranged early morning boat trip through the Bird Sanctuary. Our boatman came and met us at the hotel at 6:30 am and it was only a five minute walk to the lakeside. We were blessed with a beautiful bright calm tranquil morning. It was a fabulous way to spend a couple of hours, with just the sound of the water as our boat was being expertly punted through the lagoon, including heavily weeded areas. There were a couple of other boats on the water too but the reserve is large enough that we were on our own for 95% of the time. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable in knowing where the best locations were to see birds and he could identify them easily for us. He was also well prepared with binoculars and the Birds of Sri Lanka Guide book, as well as water and fruit for breakfast. Now my wife and I don't confess to be "twitchers" but we really enjoyed the experience, and counted 33 different species, including eight completely new ones to us. We also saw some black faced monkeys (grey langurs), and most memorable - a newly born water buffalo calf, so young it couldn't yet stand up, and our guide felt it was under 2 hours old. So...we Highly highly recommend Kalamatiya Bird Sanctuary with the guided boat trip.  You don't need to know anything about birds to take pleasure in the reserve, and if you venture out early like we did you'll still be back in time for breakfast. .
The place is really beautiful and peaceful with many different colorful birds. It was a great visit thanks to our guides !
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è beautiful morning see a lot of birds, monkeys, squirrels and water buffaloes. A guide how tells us a lot.
We all loved the tour. Super guide! There was water and cookies and bananas. And a great explanation about the birds we saw. Very recommendable!

A visit to this place is a really lovely thing to do in the morning. We went with Sadon's tuktuk from Nirvana beach hotel and at Kalamatiya we hopped on a little cat to paddle of into the wetlands. It's so peaceful and quiet, just us, a sole fisherman and the birds of course. Sadon was very knowledgeable and pointed us to many birds including a fish eagle. Home made snacks halfway through the tour were delicious. Highly recommended!

What an absolute gem this place is, almost hidden in an unspoilt corner of Sri Lanka and only circa 30 minutes transport from Tangalle. We were lucky enough to spend several hours with the original guide of this wetland wonder world Mr. Gayan Geeth who took us on his twin hulled kayak paddled by his colleague for a late afternoon visit across part of this circa 60ha national park. The scenery is stunning, the ambience peaceful and the ecology perfect to attract and maintain such numbers of a wide variety of birds, which Gayan was happy to name in English to keep his unseasoned bird watchers informed. Bottled water, fresh fruit and delicious homemade snacks were provided. Thoroughly recommended.

Kalametiya bird sanctuary is probably the best bird sanctuary in Sri Lanka. our guide, Buddhi, is very passionate and experienced with this. we went at an odd time as we didn't have time in the morning or evening. we went at 10 in the morning. Buddhi hot a boat and we left land. a few second after we left land, we saw a rose ringed parakeet at her nest. after that we looked away without moving and saw and electric line full of gull billed turns. amidst the gulls was a blue tailed bee eater. after that we paddled for 2 minutes and saw an Indian darter.  after looking at the darter we saw a white throated kingfisher. then on the top of a tree we saw a flameback woodpecker. suddenly, we looked above us and saw a lesser goldenbacked woodpecker fly for a few seconds. a tricoloured munia jumped around. after that we looked far away as we saw a bar tailed godwit and great stone plover flying. after that we saw another darter. we moved on and saw hundreds of lesser whistling ducks and black winged stilts. a few little cormorants were also seen. we saw many egret-little egrets, median egrets, great egrets and cattle egrets. we saw a few spoonbills. after that we went into a channel and saw buffaloes crossing the water.just after that, a plain prinia landed for a few seconds before flying away. through a little gap in the grass, we saw a common greenshank. a pair of the tricoloured munias followed us, jumping around. we saw an imperial green pigeon flying for a few seconds. after getting to a tree, we saw a booted eagle flying for a few seconds. we came back out and saw a spot billed pelican. after coming to a tree we saw a grey headed fish eagle perched for 10 minutes. we went back and Buddhi gave us the list. we saw 38 bird species.

I was surprised at the diversity of birds not to mention the monkeys and crocodile that we saw in our couple of hours at the sanctuary. It was a serene experience and one I‚Äôd highly recommend.  Gyan was a great host.

The boat ride with Gayan around the Lagoon was possibly the highlight of our trip to Sri Lanka. His keen eye and knowledge of the local and migratory birds were great, and he supplemented well with the book he carried too. Using his binoculars, we sighted over 30+ species of birds, and he also got us to stop to go over a rock for a unique view of the entire lagoon. The three hours spent punting around were so quiet and slow, that we never felt rushed. Also, we could easily see the birds up close which made it all the more memorable. We were lucky to get a great sunset too. Gayan was also very gracious to share some home cooked cookies (yum!) and sweet bananas with us. All in all, highly recommended. But it‚Äôs not for those who want to go there to tick another thing to do. Go there, if you like birds and natural settings and have all the time in the world to do that. But if you go, get Gayan :-)

Not a bird enthusiast but we love nature reserves. This place is a must go for all nature lovers and a heaven for bird enthusiasts. Saw quite a few species of birds and even the shy black bittern. Gayan, our guide one of the most passionate guides I've seen and definitely a very knowledgeable one as well. He provides binoculars and has a guidebook on birds which he will show you as you go along. His love and dedication to the birds and this sanctuary is admirable. Very beautiful and tranquil place. Enjoyed the morning sunrise and the slow quiet cruise on the wetlands.

We made an unscheduled visit to Kalametiya with our 'srilankatailoredtours' guide Gemunu and were lucky to catch Gayan at about 11.00am just setting off with another group. He quickly arranged for his father to punt us out on the lagoon for an impromptu 2 hour trip and because his other group were only out for one hour he joined us later. What a wonderful peaceful and serene 2 hours!! Although ideally early morning is the best time for birds we still saw amongst many others a yellow bittern and a black bittern. Gayan was so informative. He is  passionate to try and ensure that the lagoon retained its peaceful character and I would recommend that if you do visit be prepared to converse in whispers and enjoy the tranquillity! Our biggest non wildlife surprise was that despite the impromptu nature of our visit we were still treated to fruit and home made biscuits whilst watching the local fishermen casting their nets. Next time we visit Sri Lanka we will certainly include Gayan's trip in our itinerary but we'll make sure to book!

We spent 4 hours being punted on a small boat around the lagoon, incredibly peaceful, watching birdlife at this amazingly rich, wetland. The trip was carefully thought through by our guide Gayan, born locally, who is passionate about preserving the habitat for wildlife. He provided binoculars and a bird ID book to supplement his keen eyesight and knowledge. Moving gently through the reeds he pointed out bittern, darters, cormorants, herons, spoonbills, ibis, kingfishers, swamp hens, godwit and many more. The silent, slow movement of the boat made it possible to observe birds very closely. Gayan also lead us up a rock which gave panoramic views of the lagoon and beyond, explaining the local myths linked to the rock and the uses of the medicinal plants growing there. He provided welcome snacks, crispy biscuits made by his mother, sweet bananas and water. We watched the sun set over the water, tranquil and serene. Very simple, but one of our best experiences on Sri Lanka

Ranga our backwaters bird sanctuary was very helpful. Bring binoculars and your own bird guide if you are a serious bird watcher. We forgot both but enjoyed the trips tremendously since we're not serious birders. Saw and heard wild peacocks and lots of varieties of Heron, Kingfisher, ducks, cormorants and birds we heard but did not seeüòï To arranged a trip with Ranga, inquire at Turtle Bay Resort at the beach.

If you want to see piece of true nature with lots of amazing birds and such a piece and quiet go for this one and call Gayan on +94777060920. He grew up in this village and is very dedicated to this place and to what he does. Me and my fiance Jan were amazed by the beauty of this place and that there was absolutely nothing at all apart from our boat crew,birds and tranquility. You will get a pick up from the bus stop which is few miles from here and the hospitality is real,no fake,they make you feel very comfortable. Thank you Gayan,brother and Gayan the friend :-) Let there be rain.

we went early morning to see the bird at kalametiya booked with ranga . it was such best tour we have had in sri lanka . . lots of bird . . he provide all life jacket etc . we went throu lagoon he has made effort to show us bird . i want to appreciate his effort ride with stick . call him on 0716789932 he may assit you anytime his support . it was very much worthy than i paid . for 4000 you get more and more

This bird tour was most interesting tour I had with Ranga . He is very nice village men who gave us experience. He gave us his wife made sweet and king coconut while we doing tour . I may recommend him to anyone who need his assistance 0716789932 . Lots of bird and many variety. Everything was fantastic.

Kalametiya Bird Sanctuary is not a place that every Sri Lankan tourist would have on their itinerary. But, it didn't disappoint us when we decided to beat early morning blues to take a trip on the lagoon (yes, the sanctuary is around a lagoon). We saw many interesting and rare species of birds (the guide has a reference book and gives 2 binoculars for bird viewing). The lagoon was absolutely quiet and all we could hear was the sound of the birds and the water. Definitely not an experience you have everyday!

Don't miss this if you are a birdwatcher. Being poled silently through this lagoon was one of our best experiences in Sri Lanka and the birds were stunning: bittern, Stork-billed Kingfisher, Night Heron, Pied Kingfisher and much more.

We went on an early morning boat ride with Gayan and his assistant.  It was cool and the sunrise was great.  Lovely wild place with lots of birds, monkeys and water buffalo to see.  We saw Kites, several kinds of herons, a bittern, whistling ducks... too many types to list.  Other than a local fisherman, we were the only humans on the lagoon.  Quiet, except for the birds, waves and the wind.
This was an excellent reserve, we visited in November there where a large number of species of wader a flock in the thousands of Black-tailed Godwit, which where easy to get close to.

I have stared tour about 6 am with Ranga . This is awesome. Many many bird . And some monkey too. Same time you can see sun rises too. Ranga is very helpful safe boat rider with full of detail. . You can contact him directly via 0716814874 I saw kingfisher catching fish was fantastic

Wow. This is wonderful experience  ever had . Kalamatiya tours arrange me this tour too . This is fantastic . Ranga is ideal Person for this tour he is boat rider .he providing life jacket and some little snack . He is not speaking very good English . But he can explain about birds . Ranga has Assistant ride boat with stick . Safe tour with boat and lots of birds üòÄ

We arrived at this very peaceful oasis owned and managed by the Sri Lankan Wildlife conservation department about 4pm and were punted around the wetlands for just over 2 hours by Gayan and his colleague (reachable via Kalamatiyawavez@gmail.com or on +94777060920).  I believe there are other guides at the park but Gayan spoke English, was extremely knowledgeable and eagle eyed, spotting birds and mammals that were hard to see - even providing a book so you could read up about the birds he was pointing out.  He also provided binoculars and some home made cookies at the half way point.  Sadly I understand that August is really the wrong time of year to see the most plentiful of the migratory birds, but we still saw plenty and really enjoyed the peace and quiet of the sanctuary and watched the sunset as we gently punted back ...  Well worth the trip, we enjoyed it, but perhaps better at sometimes of year than others.

The best time to visit is early morning or late evening. The park does not have a wildlife office and entrance is free to all. It's off the main Matara - Hambanthota highway. You can even travel by boat in the lagoon for which you need to pay. Ensure you take a powerful lens camera and a pair of binoculars. The road is accessible by any vehicle.

This is our second time in Sri Lanka and first time down this far south. The nature reserve was beautiful and tranquil, all you heard were sound of the birds. Our guide Gayan was absolutely wonderful, very knowledgeable about the local fauna and flora, pointing out various species that call this mangrove their home. The area suffered a little due to lack of rain (image in Sri Lanka!) so the drop in water level made the water brackish, leading to a lot of the plant life dying. Gayan commented to us how green is was last year and this year still amazing, but not as green. It was a great excursion, Gayan picked us up in Tuktuks at the house we were staying at Ranawara, and took care of our travel needs. A definite must for nature lovers who plan on being in the Tangalle area.
It's a very nice place to visit if you love birds. They are plenty! The boat trip is very relaxing with the sound of birds around. We managed to see an eagle also from very close!

This was one of the highlights of our holiday. So quiet we found ourselves whispering to each other. Sunrise over the lagoon is quite spectacular. We saw so many birds, listened to a bird and frog chorus and watched Buffaloes each with their own egret. I only tend to watch birds on holiday but would expect a true bird watcher to be even more amazed at the number of different types of birds. The trip was arranged through our hotel and we were picked up by tuk tuk. Highly recommended and so relaxing.

We had a wonderful afternoon with our guide Gayan, slowly floating on a "catamaran" through the lagoon looking for  Birds. Gayan was good in finding all kinds of birds and even a crocodile and a watermonitor. It was hours of peace and calm. There was time to stop, look, listen and even have a small afternoonbreak with banans and homemade cookies, which Gayan had along. If you are looking for a different experience, try this one!

Clearly, from previous reviews, gliding through the still waters of an inland water system is not for everyone. BUT if you love wildlife and, in particular, wetland birds this is an experience not to be missed if you are in the area. All you can hear is bird call and the occasional plop of a racing frog or a jumping fish. I'll not list the birds seen as there are too many, but all identified by Mr Gayan. He supplies you with life jackets, although you can stand in most places but perhaps under caution on account of the crocodiles, water, binoculars and a bird book. You will have heard of his mother's biscuits from other reviewers. We went in the evening, four of us, although two would have given us greater access to some of the shallower parts. We all thought the experience to be pure magic!

Awesome place for a day off.There are around 50-80 birds...But all of them are pheasants and peacocks...The road to go is horrible.In a sense you have to drive in a speed of 20-30km/h.Make sure you go during daytime because there is no street lights...Cheers!

We went at dawn to see birds in this wetland nature reserve. We were punted along on a double canoe and shown lots of interesting and unusual species. Very quiet, calm and inspiring, thanks to Mr K.T.H. Gayan's expert guidance.

We took a boat trip at the bird sanctuary - punted by two men. This was very relaxing and a great way to see the birdlife which was varied and extensive. The trip was overpriced and we probably should have bargained more. It was clear that our driver had negotiated a cut from the punters and was encouraging the high price even though he'd contributed little to the organization of the trip -we had asked him to take us there because we had read about the reserve on Trip Adviser.

As part of our holiday we were lucky enough to come across Lagoon Views bird watching tour. We had the lagoon all to ourselves and this family run affair made it very special. We were rowed around the lagoon for two hours, ate mums home made coconut cookies and were given an insight into the wildlife of this area. If you like off the beaten track ...real life experiences the please give this small family a try. Kalamatiyawavez@gmail.com OR +94777060920
We saw lots of birds, monkeys, mongeese etc.  I'd not a huge fan of bird watching, but I really enjoyed it
wow, it is a great place to visit if you want to wild birds. there is a small rock to climb and when you are on the top the view is fantastic .
go to this place. good things to see.lots of birds and water all around. the rock in the middle, must climb to the top. you can see lot

Five kilometers from ranna 212 hotel. Its a huge Bird sanctuary  inside a small jungle. In the middle of the park you have a small rock and once you climb to the top , the view is fantastic. Also you can do this with a boat trip as well as by foot.

though it was not the birding season we did spot many species of birds. specially whistling ducks. there are few boat operators in the region. since the boats are not engine operated those are suitable for birding
it is a fun time for children. You can hire bicks and visit this place or take a took took. Next to this place their is a nice beach where you can have a sea swim too.
Quiet place with an unspoilt beach. Wonder why know started constructing a hotel. So peaceful. So hot out there. Pouring with swet

Picked up by Gayan and taken to the lagoon where the boat was waiting, being out on the water was so relaxing and peaceful. Gayan certainly knows his birds and wildlife, and he spotted things I would defiantly have missed. All that was needed was my camera as everything else was provided, life jacket, binoculars and water. The sunset was perfect for some fantastic photos. Our trips didn't just end with this one, as Gayan is very knowledgeable about the area and hired him for many other days out because he was polite, attentive, chilled and a good all round tour guide.

Great experience out with Gayan! Very informative and relaxing. He has great eyesight and spotted many things that we wouldn't have seen - including kingfishers, monkeys, water buffalo, and water monitors. Binoculars, a bird guide book and tasty snacks provided!

Kalametiya bird sanctuary is a beautiful area, which is worth it to explore by boat. I don‚Äôt know anything about birds, but loved to spot them in this beautiful landscape. We went on a boat trip (4000 rupees in total) with Gayan (+94 777060920 / +94  714143527), which was a great experience. He brought binoculars, water, bananas and homemade cookies by his mum, and was able to show us a lot of different birds. The quietness of the area (except for the waves at the background and all the birds that fly back to the area just before sunset), together with the openness, and being the only visitors in the whole area, made this a unique experience. We went by bus from Tangalla to the Kalametiya junction, from where Gayan picked us up by tuktuk. Try to be in the area at either sunrise or sunset, which are the best times to spot the birds, and offer the most beautiful colored landscapes!

I went with my gf on a boat to to see some birds. .being end of March the water was lower then optimum but we still enjoyed ourselves.  They guide had binoculars and bird book which help and was informative. The area was not huge but I always enjoy looking at wildlife from a boat. There is no motor so slower pave plus peace and quiet is the mode of travel I am not a birder but I enjoyed the relaxed pace and after a bit I helped pole the boat for a different experience. . Price is 4,000 rupee for the boat that holds up to 7 and an takes an afternoon . So the more there are the better the deal..

One of the previous reviews is indeed incorrect as there are no birds in cages and certainly no toilet facilities. You get taken by boat (no motor) through the lagoon and get to see many birds and also other animals. Best just before sunset and/or when the tide is high. Very interesting and peaceful experience. I was there two years ago and still remember how lovely it was :)

This is NOT a place with birds in cages or an entrance fee as some people write on this topicr. This is a protected lagoon with wild birds, which you can spot either from the Kalamatiya Road (which starts 200 meter east of the Kalamatiya Hotel) or from the lagoon with a canoe (organize with a local fisherman). The area is beautiful, quiet and full of birds. So just enjoy the area!

Very well designed and beautiful landscaping. Many exotic birds from around the world.  BUT the screening on the cages made photography difficult. Many cages had no labeling. Nice toilet facilities. Small concession stand with snacks and ice cream. Take an umbrella for the sun.
